trans-unit.source: Note that this implementation is not synchronized. If multiple threads access a map concurrently, and at least one of the threads modifies the map structurally, it must be synchronized externally. (A structural modification is any operation that adds or deletes one or more mappings; merely changing the value associated with an existing key is not a structural modification.) This is typically accomplished by synchronizing on some object that naturally encapsulates the map. If no such object exists, the map should be "wrapped" using the Collections.synchronizedSortedMap method. This is best done at creation time, to prevent accidental unsynchronized access to the map:

(Una modificación estructural es cualquier operación que agrega o elimina una o más asignaciones; simplemente cambiar el valor asociado con una clave existente no es una modificación estructural). Esto generalmente se logra mediante la sincronización en algún objeto que naturalmente encapsula el mapa. Si no existe tal objeto, el mapa debe "ajustarse" mediante el método Collections.synchronizedSortedMap . Note: As we see above, the string produced by a ChoiceFormat in MessageFormat is treated as special; occurrences of '{' are used to indicate subformats, and cause recursion. Text-Argument: A text-argument is any sequence of characters, excluding special characters (that is, common whitespace characters [0009-000D, 0020] and rule syntax characters [0021-002F, 003A-0040, 005B-0060, 007B-007E]). If those characters are desired, you can put them in single quotes (e.g. ampersand => '&'). Note that unquoted white space characters are ignored; e.g. b c is treated as bc.
trans-unit.target: Argumento de texto: un argumento de texto es cualquier secuencia de caracteres, excluidos los caracteres especiales (es decir, los caracteres de espacio en blanco comunes [0009-000D, 0020] y los caracteres de sintaxis de reglas [0021-002F, 003A-0040, 005B-0060, 007B- 007E]). Si desea esos caracteres, puede ponerlos entre comillas simples (por ejemplo, ampersand => '&'). Tenga en cuenta que los espacios en blanco sin comillas se ignoran; por ejemplo, b c se trata como bc .

trans-unit.source: Tip for Trouble-shooting:

Usage model. To motivate the behavior of add() and roll(), consider a user interface component with increment and decrement buttons for the month, day, and year, and an underlying GregorianCalendar. If the interface reads January 31, 1999 and the user presses the month increment button, what should it read? If the underlying implementation uses set(), it might read March 3, 1999. A better result would be February 28, 1999. Furthermore, if the user presses the month increment button again, it should read March 31, 1999, not March 28, 1999. By saving the original date and using either add() or roll(), depending on whether larger fields should be affected, the user interface can behave as most users will intuitively expect.
trans-unit.target: Modelo de uso . Para motivar el comportamiento de add() y roll() , considere un componente de interfaz de usuario con botones de incremento y decremento para el mes, día y año, y un GregorianCalendar subyacente . Si la interfaz lee el 31 de enero de 1999 y el usuario presiona el botón de incremento de mes, ¿qué debería leer? Si la implementación subyacente usa set() , podría leer el 3 de marzo de 1999. Un mejor resultado sería el 28 de febrero de 1999. Además, si el usuario presiona el botón de incremento de mes nuevamente, debería leer el 31 de marzo de 1999, no el 28 de marzo. , 1999. Guardando la fecha original y usando add() o roll() , dependiendo de si los campos más grandes deberían verse afectados, la interfaz de usuario puede comportarse como la mayoría de los usuarios esperan intuitivamente.

A "main" ForkJoinTask begins execution when it is explicitly submitted to a ForkJoinPool, or, if not already engaged in a ForkJoin computation, commenced in the ForkJoinPool.commonPool() via fork(), invoke(), or related methods. Once started, it will usually in turn start other subtasks. As indicated by the name of this class, many programs using ForkJoinTask employ only methods fork() and join(), or derivatives such as invokeAll. However, this class also provides a number of other methods that can come into play in advanced usages, as well as extension mechanics that allow support of new forms of fork/join processing.

A "main" ForkJoinTask begins execution when it is explicitly submitted to a ForkJoinPool, or, if not already engaged in a ForkJoin computation, commenced in the ForkJoinPool.commonPool() via fork(), invoke(), or related methods. Once started, it will usually in turn start other subtasks. As indicated by the name of this class, many programs using ForkJoinTask employ only methods fork() and join(), or derivatives such as invokeAll. However, this class also provides a number of other methods that can come into play in advanced usages, as well as extension mechanics that allow support of new forms of fork/join processing.
trans-unit.target: Un ForkJoinTask "principal" comienza la ejecución cuando se envía explícitamente a un ForkJoinPool o, si aún no está involucrado en un cálculo de ForkJoin, comienza en ForkJoinPool.commonPool() través de fork() , invoke() o métodos relacionados. Una vez iniciado, normalmente iniciará otras subtareas. Como lo indica el nombre de esta clase, muchos programas que usan ForkJoinTask emplean solo los métodos fork() y join() , o derivados como invokeAll . Sin embargo, esta clase también proporciona una serie de otros métodos que pueden entrar en juego en usos avanzados, así como mecánicas de extensión que permiten admitir nuevas formas de procesamiento de bifurcaciones / combinaciones.

A "root class" is determined as follows: if the remote object's class directly implements an interface that extends Remote, then the remote object's class is the root class; otherwise, the root class is the most derived superclass of the remote object's class that directly implements an interface that extends Remote.
A "uses service-name" directive.

A 'requires' directive (irrespective of 'transitive') expresses that one module depends on some other module. The effect of the 'transitive' modifier is to cause additional modules to also depend on the other module. If module M 'requires transitive N', then not only does M depend on N, but any module that depends on M also depends on N. This allows M to be refactored so that some or all of its content can be moved to a new module N without breaking modules that have a 'requires M' directive.

A ZoneOffset represents the period of time that local time differs from UTC/Greenwich. This is usually a fixed number of hours and minutes. It is equivalent to the total amount of the offset in seconds. For example, during the winter Paris has an offset of +01:00, which is 3600 seconds.

A ZoneOffset represents the period of time that local time differs from UTC/Greenwich. This is usually a fixed number of hours and minutes. It is equivalent to the total amount of the offset in seconds. For example, during the winter Paris has an offset of +01:00, which is 3600 seconds.
trans-unit.target: Un ZoneOffset representa el período de tiempo en el que la hora local difiere de UTC / Greenwich. Suele ser un número fijo de horas y minutos. Es equivalente a la total amount de compensación en segundos. Por ejemplo, durante el invierno, París tiene un desplazamiento de +01:00 , que es de 3600 segundos.

trans-unit.source: A BlockingQueue in which producers may wait for consumers to receive elements.
trans-unit.target: Un BlockingQueue en el que los productores pueden esperar a que los consumidores reciban elementos.

trans-unit.source: A BlockingQueue in which producers may wait for consumers to receive elements. A TransferQueue may be useful for example in message passing applications in which producers sometimes (using method transfer(E)) await receipt of elements by consumers invoking take or poll, while at other times enqueue elements (via method put) without waiting for receipt. Non-blocking and time-out versions of tryTransfer are also available. A TransferQueue may also be queried, via hasWaitingConsumer(), whether there are any threads waiting for items, which is a converse analogy to a peek operation.

A BlockingQueue in which producers may wait for consumers to receive elements. A TransferQueue may be useful for example in message passing applications in which producers sometimes (using method transfer(E)) await receipt of elements by consumers invoking take or poll, while at other times enqueue elements (via method put) without waiting for receipt. Non-blocking and time-out versions of tryTransfer are also available. A TransferQueue may also be queried, via hasWaitingConsumer(), whether there are any threads waiting for items, which is a converse analogy to a peek operation.
trans-unit.target: Un BlockingQueue en el que los productores pueden esperar a que los consumidores reciban elementos. Una TransferQueue puede ser útil, por ejemplo, en aplicaciones de paso de mensajes en las que los productores a veces (usando la transfer(E) método (E) ) esperan la recepción de elementos por parte de los consumidores que invocan take o poll , mientras que otras veces ponen elementos en cola (a través del método put ) sin esperar la recepción. También están disponibles las versiones sin bloqueo y con tiempo de espera de tryTransfer . También se puede consultar una TransferQueue , a través de hasWaitingConsumer() , si hay subprocesos esperando elementos, que es una analogía inversa a una operación de peek .

trans-unit.source: A blocking queue in which each insert operation must wait for a corresponding remove operation by another thread, and vice versa.
trans-unit.target: Una cola de bloqueo en la que cada operación de inserción debe esperar una operación de eliminación correspondiente por parte de otro subproceso, y viceversa.

trans-unit.source: A blocking queue in which each insert operation must wait for a corresponding remove operation by another thread, and vice versa. A synchronous queue does not have any internal capacity, not even a capacity of one. You cannot peek at a synchronous queue because an element is only present when you try to remove it; you cannot insert an element (using any method) unless another thread is trying to remove it; you cannot iterate as there is nothing to iterate. The head of the queue is the element that the first queued inserting thread is trying to add to the queue; if there is no such queued thread then no element is available for removal and poll() will return null. For purposes of other Collection methods (for example contains), a SynchronousQueue acts as an empty collection. This queue does not permit null elements.
trans-unit.target: Una cola de bloqueo en la que cada operación de inserción debe esperar una operación de eliminación correspondiente por parte de otro subproceso, y viceversa. Una cola síncrona no tiene capacidad interna, ni siquiera la capacidad de una. No puede peek un vistazo a una cola síncrona porque un elemento solo está presente cuando intenta eliminarlo; no puede insertar un elemento (usando cualquier método) a menos que otro hilo esté intentando eliminarlo; no puede iterar porque no hay nada que iterar. El encabezado de la cola es el elemento que el primer subproceso de inserción de la cola está intentando agregar a la cola; si no hay tal hilo en cola, no hay ningún elemento disponible para su eliminación y poll() devolverá null . Para propósitos de otra Collection métodos (por ejemplo, contains ), SynchronousQueue actúa como una colección vacía. Esta cola no permite elementos null .

trans-unit.source: A malformed-input result indicates that a malformed-input error has been detected. The malformed bytes begin at the input buffer's (possibly incremented) position; the number of malformed bytes may be determined by invoking the result object's length method. This case applies only if the malformed action of this decoder is CodingErrorAction.REPORT; otherwise the malformed input will be ignored or replaced, as requested.

A malformed-input result indicates that a malformed-input error has been detected. The malformed characters begin at the input buffer's (possibly incremented) position; the number of malformed characters may be determined by invoking the result object's length method. This case applies only if the malformed action of this encoder is CodingErrorAction.REPORT; otherwise the malformed input will be ignored or replaced, as requested.

A malformed-input result indicates that a malformed-input error has been detected. The malformed bytes begin at the input buffer's (possibly incremented) position; the number of malformed bytes may be determined by invoking the result object's length method. This case applies only if the malformed action of this decoder is CodingErrorAction.REPORT; otherwise the malformed input will be ignored or replaced, as requested.
trans-unit.target: Un resultado de entrada con formato incorrecto indica que se ha detectado un error de entrada con formato incorrecto. Los bytes con formato incorrecto comienzan en la posición del búfer de entrada (posiblemente incrementada); el número de bytes con formato incorrecto se puede determinar invocando el método de length del objeto de resultado . Este caso se aplica solo si la acción mal formada de este decodificador es CodingErrorAction.REPORT ; de lo contrario, la entrada con formato incorrecto será ignorada o reemplazada, según se solicite.

trans-unit.source: A Collection has an encounter order if the corresponding Collection.iterator() documents an order. If so, the encounter order is the same as the documented order. Otherwise, a collection does not have an encounter order.

A Collection has an encounter order if the corresponding Collection.iterator() documents an order. If so, the encounter order is the same as the documented order. Otherwise, a collection does not have an encounter order.
trans-unit.target: Una Collection tiene una orden de encuentro si el correspondiente Collection.iterator() documenta una orden. Si es así, el orden de encuentro es el mismo que el orden documentado. De lo contrario, una colección no tiene un orden de encuentro.

trans-unit.source: A Collector that supports concurrent reduction is marked with the Collector.Characteristics.CONCURRENT characteristic. However, a concurrent collection also has a downside. If multiple threads are depositing results concurrently into a shared container, the order in which results are deposited is non-deterministic. Consequently, a concurrent reduction is only possible if ordering is not important for the stream being processed. The Stream.collect(Collector) implementation will only perform a concurrent reduction if

A Collector that supports concurrent reduction is marked with the Collector.Characteristics.CONCURRENT characteristic. However, a concurrent collection also has a downside. If multiple threads are depositing results concurrently into a shared container, the order in which results are deposited is non-deterministic. Consequently, a concurrent reduction is only possible if ordering is not important for the stream being processed. The Stream.collect(Collector) implementation will only perform a concurrent reduction if
trans-unit.target: Un Collector que admite la reducción simultánea se marca con la característica Collector.Characteristics.CONCURRENT . Sin embargo, una recopilación simultánea también tiene una desventaja. Si varios subprocesos están depositando resultados simultáneamente en un contenedor compartido, el orden en el que se depositan los resultados no es determinista. En consecuencia, una reducción simultánea solo es posible si el pedido no es importante para la transmisión que se está procesando. trans-unit.source: A CompletionService that uses a supplied Executor to execute tasks. This class arranges that submitted tasks are, upon completion, placed on a queue accessible using take. The class is lightweight enough to be suitable for transient use when processing groups of tasks.

La clase es lo suficientemente liviana como para ser adecuada para un uso transitorio al procesar grupos de tareas.

trans-unit.source: A CounterMonitor observes attributes of integer type. The attributes are assumed to be non-negative, and monotonically increasing except for a possible roll-over at a specified modulus. Each observed attribute has an associated threshold value. A notification is sent when the attribute exceeds its threshold.

Se supone que los atributos no son negativos y que aumentan monótonamente excepto por un posible vuelco en un módulo especificado . Cada atributo observado tiene un valor umbral asociado . Se envía una notificación cuando el atributo supera su umbral.

trans-unit.source: A Flow.Publisher that asynchronously issues submitted (non-null) items to current subscribers until it is closed.

A Flow.Publisher that asynchronously issues submitted (non-null) items to current subscribers until it is closed. Each current subscriber receives newly submitted items in the same order unless drops or exceptions are encountered. Using a SubmissionPublisher allows item generators to act as compliant reactive-streams Publishers relying on drop handling and/or blocking for flow control.

A Flow.Subscriber arranges that items be requested and processed. Items (invocations of Flow.Subscriber.onNext(T)) are not issued unless requested, but multiple items may be requested. Many Subscriber implementations can arrange this in the style of the following example, where a buffer size of 1 single-steps, and larger sizes usually allow for more efficient overlapped processing with less communication; for example with a value of 64, this keeps total outstanding requests between 32 and 64. Because Subscriber method invocations for a given Flow.Subscription are strictly ordered, there is no need for these methods to use locks or volatiles unless a Subscriber maintains multiple Subscriptions (in which case it is better to instead define multiple Subscribers, each with its own Subscription).
A ForkJoinTask with a completion action performed when triggered and there are no remaining pending actions.
trans-unit.target: Un ForkJoinTask con una acción de finalización realizada cuando se activa y no hay acciones pendientes restantes.

trans-unit.source: A ForkJoinTask with a completion action performed when triggered and there are no remaining pending actions. CountedCompleters are in general more robust in the presence of subtask stalls and blockage than are other forms of ForkJoinTasks, but are less intuitive to program. Uses of CountedCompleter are similar to those of other completion based components (such as CompletionHandler) except that multiple pending completions may be necessary to trigger the completion action onCompletion(CountedCompleter), not just one. Unless initialized otherwise, the pending count starts at zero, but may be (atomically) changed using methods setPendingCount(int), addToPendingCount(int), and compareAndSetPendingCount(int, int). Upon invocation of tryComplete(), if the pending action count is nonzero, it is decremented; otherwise, the completion action is performed, and if this completer itself has a completer, the process is continued with its completer. As is the case with related synchronization components such as Phaser and Semaphore, these methods affect only internal counts; they do not establish any further internal bookkeeping. In particular, the identities of pending tasks are not maintained. As illustrated below, you can create subclasses that do record some or all pending tasks or their results when needed. As illustrated below, utility methods supporting customization of completion traversals are also provided. However, because CountedCompleters provide only basic synchronization mechanisms, it may be useful to create further abstract subclasses that maintain linkages, fields, and additional support methods appropriate for a set of related usages.

A ForkJoinTask with a completion action performed when triggered and there are no remaining pending actions. CountedCompleters are in general more robust in the presence of subtask stalls and blockage than are other forms of ForkJoinTasks, but are less intuitive to program. Uses of CountedCompleter are similar to those of other completion based components (such as CompletionHandler) except that multiple pending completions may be necessary to trigger the completion action onCompletion(CountedCompleter), not just one. Unless initialized otherwise, the pending count starts at zero, but may be (atomically) changed using methods setPendingCount(int), addToPendingCount(int), and compareAndSetPendingCount(int, int). Upon invocation of tryComplete(), if the pending action count is nonzero, it is decremented; otherwise, the completion action is performed, and if this completer itself has a completer, the process is continued with its completer. As is the case with related synchronization components such as Phaser and Semaphore, these methods affect only internal counts; they do not establish any further internal bookkeeping. In particular, the identities of pending tasks are not maintained. As illustrated below, you can create subclasses that do record some or all pending tasks or their results when needed. As illustrated below, utility methods supporting customization of completion traversals are also provided. However, because CountedCompleters provide only basic synchronization mechanisms, it may be useful to create further abstract subclasses that maintain linkages, fields, and additional support methods appropriate for a set of related usages.
trans-unit.target: Un ForkJoinTask con una acción de finalización realizada cuando se activa y no hay acciones pendientes restantes. Los CountedCompleters son, en general, más sólidos en presencia de bloqueos y bloqueos de subtareas que otras formas de ForkJoinTasks, pero su programación es menos intuitiva. Los usos de CountedCompleter son similares a los de otros componentes basados ​​en la finalización (como CompletionHandler ), excepto que pueden ser necesarias varias finalizaciones pendientes para activar la acción de finalización onCompletion(CountedCompleter) , no solo una. A menos que se inicialice de otra manera, el recuento pendiente comienza en cero, pero puede cambiarse (atómicamente) usando los métodos setPendingCount(int) , addToPendingCount(int) y compareAndSetPendingCount(int, int) . Tras la invocación de tryComplete() , si el recuento de acciones pendientes es distinto de cero, se reduce; de lo contrario, se lleva a cabo la acción de finalización, y si esta persona que completa en sí misma tiene una persona que completa, el proceso continúa con su persona que completa. Como es el caso de componentes de sincronización relacionados como Phaser y Semaphore , estos métodos afectan solo a los recuentos internos; no establecen ninguna contabilidad interna adicional. En particular, no se mantienen las identidades de las tareas pendientes. Como se ilustra a continuación, puede crear subclases que registren algunas o todas las tareas pendientes o sus resultados cuando sea necesario. Como se ilustra a continuación, también se proporcionan métodos de utilidad que admiten la personalización de recorridos de terminación. Sin embargo, debido a que CountedCompleters solo proporciona mecanismos básicos de sincronización, puede ser útil crear más subclases abstractas que mantengan vínculos, campos y métodos de soporte adicionales apropiados para un conjunto de usos relacionados.

A Keymap lets an application bind key strokes to actions. In order to allow keymaps to be shared across multiple text components, they can use actions that extend TextAction. A Map that further provides a total ordering on its keys.
trans-unit.target: Un Map que además proporciona un orden total en sus claves.

trans-unit.source: A Map that further provides a total ordering on its keys. The map is ordered according to the natural ordering of its keys, or by a Comparator typically provided at sorted map creation time. This order is reflected when iterating over the sorted map's collection views (returned by the entrySet, keySet and values methods). Several additional operations are provided to take advantage of the ordering. (This interface is the map analogue of SortedSet.)

Se proporcionan varias operaciones adicionales para aprovechar el pedido. (Esta interfaz es el mapa análogo de SortedSet ).

trans-unit.source: A Schema object is immutable in the sense that it shouldn't change the set of constraints once it is created. In other words, if an application validates the same document twice against the same Schema, it must always produce the same result.
A Schema object is thread safe and applications are encouraged to share it across many parsers in many threads.
A Schema object is usually created from SchemaFactory.

A selector is a multiplexor of selectable channels, which in turn are a special type of channel that can be put into non-blocking mode. To perform multiplexed I/O operations, one or more selectable channels are first created, put into non-blocking mode, and registered with a selector. Registering a channel specifies the set of I/O operations that will be tested for readiness by the selector, and returns a selection key that represents the registration.

A selector is a multiplexor of selectable channels, which in turn are a special type of channel that can be put into non-blocking mode. To perform multiplexed I/O operations, one or more selectable channels are first created, put into non-blocking mode, and registered with a selector. Registering a channel specifies the set of I/O operations that will be tested for readiness by the selector, and returns a selection key that represents the registration.
trans-unit.target: Un selector es un multiplexor de canales seleccionables , que a su vez son un tipo especial de canal que se puede poner en modo sin bloqueo . Para realizar operaciones de E / S multiplexadas, primero se crean uno o más canales seleccionables, se ponen en modo sin bloqueo y se registered con un selector. El registro de un canal especifica el conjunto de operaciones de E / S cuya preparación el selector comprobará y devuelve una clave de selección que representa el registro.

trans-unit.source: A SortedMap extended with navigation methods returning the closest matches for given search targets. Methods lowerEntry(K), floorEntry(K), ceilingEntry(K), and higherEntry(K) return Map.Entry objects associated with keys respectively less than, less than or equal, greater than or equal, and greater than a given key, returning null if there is no such key. Similarly, methods lowerKey(K), floorKey(K), ceilingKey(K), and higherKey(K) return only the associated keys. All of these methods are designed for locating, not traversing entries.

A SortedMap extended with navigation methods returning the closest matches for given search targets. Methods lowerEntry, floorEntry, ceilingEntry, and higherEntry return Map.Entry objects associated with keys respectively less than, less than or equal, greater than or equal, and greater than a given key, returning null if there is no such key. Similarly, methods lowerKey, floorKey, ceilingKey, and higherKey return only the associated keys. All of these methods are designed for locating, not traversing entries.
trans-unit.target: Un SortedMap ampliado con métodos de navegación que devuelven las coincidencias más cercanas para determinados objetivos de búsqueda. Los métodos lowerEntry , floorEntry , ceilingEntry y higherEntry devuelven los objetos Map.Entry asociados con claves respectivamente menor que, menor que o igual, mayor o igual que una clave dada, devolviendo un null si no existe dicha clave. Del mismo modo, los métodos lowerKey , floorKey , ceilingKey y higherKey devuelven solo las claves asociadas. Todos estos métodos están diseñados para localizar, no atravesar entradas.

trans-unit.source: A SortedSet extended with navigation methods reporting closest matches for given search targets. Methods lower(E), floor(E), ceiling(E), and higher(E) return elements respectively less than, less than or equal, greater than or equal, and greater than a given element, returning null if there is no such element.

A SortedSet extended with navigation methods reporting closest matches for given search targets. Methods lower, floor, ceiling, and higher return elements respectively less than, less than or equal, greater than or equal, and greater than a given element, returning null if there is no such element. A NavigableSet may be accessed and traversed in either ascending or descending order. The descendingSet method returns a view of the set with the senses of all relational and directional methods inverted. The performance of ascending operations and views is likely to be faster than that of descending ones. This interface additionally defines methods pollFirst and pollLast that return and remove the lowest and highest element, if one exists, else returning null. Methods subSet, headSet, and tailSet differ from the like-named SortedSet methods in accepting additional arguments describing whether lower and upper bounds are inclusive versus exclusive. Subsets of any NavigableSet must implement the NavigableSet interface.
trans-unit.target: Un SortedSet ampliado con métodos de navegación que informan coincidencias más cercanas para determinados objetivos de búsqueda. Los métodos lower , floor , ceiling y higher devuelven elementos respectivamente menor, menor o igual, mayor o igual que un elemento dado, devolviendo null si no existe tal elemento. Se puede acceder a un NavigableSet y recorrerlo en orden ascendente o descendente. El conjunto descendingSet El método devuelve una vista del conjunto con los sentidos de todos los métodos relacionales y direccionales invertidos. Es probable que el rendimiento de las operaciones y vistas ascendentes sea más rápido que el de las descendentes. Esta interfaz define además los métodos pollFirst y pollLast que devuelven y eliminan el elemento más bajo y más alto, si existe, de lo contrario devuelven null . Los métodos subSet , headSet y tailSet se diferencian de los métodos SortedSet con el mismo nombre en la aceptación de argumentos adicionales que describen si los límites inferior y superior son inclusivos o exclusivos. Los subconjuntos de cualquier NavigableSet deben implementar el NavigableSet interfaz.

This class is preferable to Timer when multiple worker threads are needed, or when the additional flexibility or capabilities of ThreadPoolExecutor (which this class extends) are required.

trans-unit.source: A TransformerConfigurationException may be thrown if for any reason a Transformer can not be created. A TransformerConfigurationException may be thrown if there is a syntax error in the transformation instructions, for example when TransformerFactory.newTransformer(javax.xml.transform.Source) is called.
A ValidatorHandler is automatically reset every time the startDocument method is invoked.
A ValidatorHandler may buffer events to certain extent, but to allow ValidatorHandler to be used by a parser, the following requirement has to be met.

A ValidatorHandler object is not thread-safe and not reentrant. In other words, it is the application's responsibility to make sure that one ValidatorHandler object is not used from more than one thread at any given time.

A Watchable object is registered with a watch service by invoking its register method, returning a WatchKey to represent the registration. When an event for an object is detected the key is signalled, and if not currently signalled, it is queued to the watch service so that it can be retrieved by consumers that invoke the poll or take methods to retrieve keys and process events. Once the events have been processed the consumer invokes the key's reset method to reset the key which allows the key to be signalled and re-queued with further events.

A Watchable object is registered with a watch service by invoking its register method, returning a WatchKey to represent the registration. When an event for an object is detected the key is signalled, and if not currently signalled, it is queued to the watch service so that it can be retrieved by consumers that invoke the poll or take methods to retrieve keys and process events. Once the events have been processed the consumer invokes the key's reset method to reset the key which allows the key to be signalled and re-queued with further events.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto Watchable se registra con un servicio de vigilancia invocando su método de register , devolviendo una WatchKey para representar el registro. Cuando se detecta un evento para un objeto, la clave se señaliza y, si no está señalizada actualmente, se coloca en la cola del servicio de vigilancia para que los consumidores puedan recuperarla que invocan la poll o take métodos para recuperar claves y procesar eventos. Una vez que los eventos han sido procesados invoca el consumo de la tecla reset método para restablecer la clave que permite que la clave para ser señalado y volver a poner en cola con otros eventos.

trans-unit.source: A week year is in sync with a WEEK_OF_YEAR cycle. All weeks between the first and last weeks (inclusive) have the same week year value. Therefore, the first and last days of a week year may have different calendar year values.

A week year is in sync with a WEEK_OF_YEAR cycle. All weeks between the first and last weeks (inclusive) have the same week year value. Therefore, the first and last days of a week year may have different calendar year values.
trans-unit.target: Un año semanal está sincronizado con un ciclo WEEK_OF_YEAR . Todas las semanas entre la primera y la última semana (inclusive) tienen el mismo valor de año de semana . Por lo tanto, el primer y último día de un año de la semana pueden tener diferentes valores de año calendario.

trans-unit.source: A BeanContextChild, or any arbitrary object associated with a BeanContextChild, may obtain a reference to a currently registered service from its nesting BeanContextServices via invocation of this method.

trans-unit.source: A BeanContextMembershipEvent encapsulates the list of children added to, or removed from, the membership of a particular BeanContext. An instance of this event is fired whenever a successful add(), remove(), retainAll(), removeAll(), or clear() is invoked on a given BeanContext instance. Objects interested in receiving events of this type must implement the BeanContextMembershipListener interface, and must register their intent via the BeanContext's addBeanContextMembershipListener(BeanContextMembershipListener bcml) method.
trans-unit.target: Un BeanContextMembershipEvent encapsula la lista de hijos agregados o eliminados de la membresía de un BeanContext en particular . Una instancia de este evento se dispara siempre que se invoca con éxito un add (), remove (), retenerAll (), removeAll () o clear () en una instancia de BeanContext dada . Objetos interesados en recibir eventos de este tipo deben implementar la BeanContextMembershipListener interfaz, y deben registrar su intención a través de la BeanContext 's addBeanContextMembershipListener(BeanContextMembershipListener bcml) método.

trans-unit.source: A BitSet is not safe for multithreaded use without external synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Un BitSet no es seguro para uso multiproceso sin sincronización externa.

trans-unit.source: A BlockingDeque implementation may be used directly as a FIFO BlockingQueue. The methods inherited from the BlockingQueue interface are precisely equivalent to BlockingDeque methods as indicated in the following table:
trans-unit.target: Una implementación de BlockingDeque puede usarse directamente como FIFO BlockingQueue . Los métodos heredados de la interfaz BlockingQueue son exactamente equivalentes a los métodos BlockingDeque como se indica en la siguiente tabla:

trans-unit.source: A BlockingQueue does not intrinsically support any kind of "close" or "shutdown" operation to indicate that no more items will be added. The needs and usage of such features tend to be implementation-dependent. For example, a common tactic is for producers to insert special end-of-stream or poison objects, that are interpreted accordingly when taken by consumers.
trans-unit.target: Un BlockingQueue qué no admite intrínsecamente cualquier tipo de "cerrar" o "apagado" para indicar que la operación no se añadirán más artículos. Las necesidades y el uso de tales características tienden a depender de la implementación. Por ejemplo, una táctica común es que los productores inserten objetos especiales de fin de flujo o venenosos , que se interpretan en consecuencia cuando los consumidores los toman.

trans-unit.source: A BlockingQueue does not accept null elements. Implementations throw NullPointerException on attempts to add, put or offer a null. A null is used as a sentinel value to indicate failure of poll operations.
trans-unit.target: Un BlockingQueue no acepta elementos null . Las implementaciones lanzan NullPointerException en los intentos de add , put u offer un null . Un null se utiliza como valor centinela para indicar el fracaso de las operaciones de poll .

trans-unit.source: A BlockingQueue may be capacity bounded. At any given time it may have a remainingCapacity beyond which no additional elements can be put without blocking. A BlockingQueue without any intrinsic capacity constraints always reports a remaining capacity of Integer.MAX_VALUE.
trans-unit.target: Un BlockingQueue puede tener un límite de capacidad. En cualquier momento puede tener una capacidad remainingCapacity más allá de la cual no se pueden put elementos adicionales sin bloquear. Un BlockingQueue sin restricciones de capacidad intrínseca siempre informa una capacidad restante de Integer.MAX_VALUE .

trans-unit.source: A BodyHandler is a function that takes a ResponseInfo object; and which returns a BodySubscriber. The BodyHandler is invoked when the response status code and headers are available, but before the response body bytes are received.
A BodyPublisher converts high-level Java objects into a flow of byte buffers suitable for sending as a request body.
A BodyPublisher converts high-level Java objects into a flow of byte buffers suitable for sending as a request body. The class BodyPublishers provides implementations of many common publishers.
A BodyPublisher that reports a content length of 0 may not be subscribed to by the HTTP Client, as it has effectively no data to publish.
A BodySubscriber consumes response body bytes and converts them into a higher-level Java type.
A BodySubscriber consumes response body bytes and converts them into a higher-level Java type. The class BodySubscriber provides implementations of many common body subscribers.
A BodySubscriber which publishes the response body through a Publisher<List<ByteBuffer>>.
A BooleanControl provides the ability to switch between two possible settings that affect a line's audio.
trans-unit.target: Un BooleanControl proporciona la capacidad de cambiar entre dos posibles configuraciones que afectan el audio de una línea.

trans-unit.source: A BooleanControl provides the ability to switch between two possible settings that affect a line's audio. The settings are boolean values (true and false). A graphical user interface might represent the control by a two-state button, an on/off switch, two mutually exclusive buttons, or a checkbox (among other possibilities). For example, depressing a button might activate a MUTE control to silence the line's audio.

A BooleanControl provides the ability to switch between two possible settings that affect a line's audio. The settings are boolean values (true and false). A graphical user interface might represent the control by a two-state button, an on/off switch, two mutually exclusive buttons, or a checkbox (among other possibilities). For example, depressing a button might activate a MUTE control to silence the line's audio.
trans-unit.target: Un BooleanControl proporciona la capacidad de cambiar entre dos posibles configuraciones que afectan el audio de una línea. Los ajustes son valores booleanos ( true y false ). Una interfaz gráfica de usuario puede representar el control mediante un botón de dos estados, un interruptor de encendido / apagado, dos botones mutuamente excluyentes o una casilla de verificación (entre otras posibilidades). Por ejemplo, presionar un botón puede activar un control MUTE para silenciar el audio de la línea.

trans-unit.source: A BufferedInputStream adds functionality to another input stream-namely, the ability to buffer the input and to support the mark and reset methods.
trans-unit.target: Un BufferedInputStream agrega funcionalidad a otro flujo de entrada, a saber, la capacidad de almacenar en búfer la entrada y admitir los métodos de mark y reset .

trans-unit.source: A BufferedInputStream adds functionality to another input stream-namely, the ability to buffer the input and to support the mark and reset methods. When the BufferedInputStream is created, an internal buffer array is created. As bytes from the stream are read or skipped, the internal buffer is refilled as necessary from the contained input stream, many bytes at a time. The mark operation remembers a point in the input stream and the reset operation causes all the bytes read since the most recent mark operation to be reread before new bytes are taken from the contained input stream.
trans-unit.target: Un BufferedInputStream agrega funcionalidad a otro flujo de entrada, a saber, la capacidad de almacenar en búfer la entrada y admitir los métodos de mark y reset . Cuando se crea BufferedInputStream , se crea una matriz de búfer interna. A medida que se leen o se saltan los bytes del flujo, el búfer interno se rellena según sea necesario desde el flujo de entrada contenido, muchos bytes a la vez. La operación de mark recuerda un punto en el flujo de entrada y la operación de reset hace que todos los bytes leídos desde la operación de mark más reciente se vuelvan a leer antes de que se tomen nuevos bytes del flujo de entrada contenido.

trans-unit.source: A Builder checks the components and invariants as components are added to the builder. The rationale for this is to detect errors as early as possible and not defer all validation to the build method.
A Builder object is obtained by invoking one of the newBuilder methods defined by the AclEntry class.
A Builder object is obtained by invoking one of the newBuilder methods defined by the AclEntry class.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto Builder se obtiene invocando uno de los métodos newBuilder definidos por la clase AclEntry .

trans-unit.source: A ButtonGroup can be used with any set of objects that inherit from AbstractButton. Typically a button group contains instances of JRadioButton, JRadioButtonMenuItem, or JToggleButton. It wouldn't make sense to put an instance of JButton or JMenuItem in a button group because JButton and JMenuItem don't implement the selected state.
A ByteArrayInputStream contains an internal buffer that contains bytes that may be read from the stream.
trans-unit.target: Un ByteArrayInputStream contiene un búfer interno que contiene bytes que pueden leerse de la secuencia.

trans-unit.source: A ByteArrayInputStream contains an internal buffer that contains bytes that may be read from the stream. An internal counter keeps track of the next byte to be supplied by the read method.
trans-unit.target: Un ByteArrayInputStream contiene un búfer interno que contiene bytes que pueden leerse de la secuencia. Un contador interno realiza un seguimiento del siguiente byte que debe suministrar el método de read .

trans-unit.source: A ByteChannel connected to an entity that contains a variable-length sequence of bytes
trans-unit.target: Un ByteChannel conectado a una entidad que contiene una secuencia de bytes de longitud variable

trans-unit.source: A CRLSelector that selects X509CRLs that match all specified criteria.
trans-unit.target: Un CRLSelector que selecciona X509CRLs que coinciden con todos los criterios especificados.

trans-unit.source: A CRLSelector that selects X509CRLs that match all specified criteria. This class is particularly useful when selecting CRLs from a CertStore to check revocation status of a particular certificate.
trans-unit.target: Un CRLSelector que selecciona X509CRLs que coinciden con todos los criterios especificados. Esta clase es particularmente útil cuando se seleccionan CRL de un CertStore para verificar el estado de revocación de un certificado en particular.

trans-unit.source: A CachedRowSet implementation should always be instantiated with an available SyncProvider mechanism, but there are cases where resetting the SyncProvider object is desirable or necessary. For example, an application might want to use the default SyncProvider object for a time and then choose to use a provider that has more recently become available and better fits its needs.
A CachedRowSet object is a

A CachedRowSet object is a container for rows of data that caches its rows in memory, which makes it possible to operate without always being connected to its data source. Further, it is a JavaBeans™ component and is scrollable, updatable, and serializable. A CachedRowSet object typically contains rows from a result set, but it can also contain rows from any file with a tabular format, such as a spread sheet. The reference implementation supports getting data only from a ResultSet object, but developers can extend the SyncProvider implementations to provide access to other tabular data sources.

A CachedRowSet object may use any SyncProvider implementation that has been registered with the SyncFactory singleton. An application can find out which SyncProvider implementations have been registered by calling the following line of code.

A Calendar object can produce all the calendar field values needed to implement the date-time formatting for a particular language and calendar style (for example, Japanese-Gregorian, Japanese-Traditional). Calendar defines the range of values returned by certain calendar fields, as well as their meaning. For example, the first month of the calendar system has value MONTH == JANUARY for all calendars. Other values are defined by the concrete subclass, such as ERA. See individual field documentation and subclass documentation for details.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto Calendar io puede producir todos los valores de campo de calendario necesarios para implementar el formato de fecha y hora para un idioma y estilo de calendario en particular (por ejemplo, japonés-gregoriano, japonés-tradicional). Calendar io define el rango de valores devueltos por ciertos campos de calendario, así como su significado. Por ejemplo, el primer mes del sistema de calendario tiene el valor MONTH == JANUARY para todos los calendarios. Otros valores están definidos por la subclase concreta, como ERA . Consulte la documentación de campo individual y la documentación de la subclase para obtener más detalles.

trans-unit.source: A CallSite is a holder for a variable MethodHandle, which is called its target.
trans-unit.target: Un CallSite es un soporte para una variable MethodHandle , que se llama su target .

trans-unit.source: A CallSite is a holder for a variable MethodHandle, which is called its target. An invokedynamic instruction linked to a CallSite delegates all calls to the site's current target. A CallSite may be associated with several invokedynamic instructions, or it may be "free floating", associated with none. In any case, it may be invoked through an associated method handle called its dynamic invoker.

A CallSite is a holder for a variable MethodHandle, which is called its target. An invokedynamic instruction linked to a CallSite delegates all calls to the site's current target. A CallSite may be associated with several invokedynamic instructions, or it may be "free floating", associated with none. In any case, it may be invoked through an associated method handle called its dynamic invoker.
trans-unit.target: Un CallSite es un soporte para una variable MethodHandle , que se llama su target . Una instrucción invokedynamic vinculada a un CallSite delega todas las llamadas al destino actual del sitio. Un CallSite puede estar asociado con varias instrucciones invokedynamic , o puede ser "flotante libre", asociado con ninguna. En cualquier caso, puede invocarse a través de un identificador de método asociado llamado su invocador dinámico .

trans-unit.source: A CallableStatement can return one ResultSet object or multiple ResultSet objects. Multiple ResultSet objects are handled using operations inherited from Statement.
A CanonicalizationMethod instance may be created by invoking the newCanonicalizationMethod method of the XMLSignatureFactory class.
A Canvas component represents a blank rectangular area of the screen onto which the application can draw or from which the application can trap input events from the user.
A CardLayout object is a layout manager for a container.

A CardLayout object is a layout manager for a container. It treats each component in the container as a card. Only one card is visible at a time, and the container acts as a stack of cards. The first component added to a CardLayout object is the visible component when the container is first displayed.
A CertPathBuilderException provides support for wrapping exceptions. The getCause method returns the throwable, if any, that caused this exception to be thrown.
A CertPathBuilderException provides support for wrapping exceptions. The getCause method returns the throwable, if any, that caused this exception to be thrown.
trans-unit.target: Una CertPathBuilderException proporciona soporte para envolver excepciones. El método getCause devuelve el valor arrojable, si lo hubiera, que provocó que se lanzara esta excepción.

trans-unit.source: A CertPathChecker implementation is typically created to extend a certification path validation algorithm. For example, an implementation may check for and process a critical private extension of each certificate in a certification path.
trans-unit.target: Una implementación de CertPathChecker generalmente se crea para extender un algoritmo de validación de ruta de certificación. Por ejemplo, una implementación puede buscar y procesar una extensión privada crítica de cada certificado en una ruta de certificación.

trans-unit.source: A CertPathValidatorException may also include the certification path that was being validated when the exception was thrown, the index of the certificate in the certification path that caused the exception to be thrown, and the reason that caused the failure. Use the getCertPath, getIndex, and getReason methods to retrieve this information.

A CertPathValidatorException may also include the certification path that was being validated when the exception was thrown, the index of the certificate in the certification path that caused the exception to be thrown, and the reason that caused the failure. Use the getCertPath, getIndex, and getReason methods to retrieve this information.

Utilice los getCertPath , getIndex y getReason para recuperar esta información.

trans-unit.target: Un CharSequence es una secuencia legible de valores char .

trans-unit.target: Un CharSequence es una secuencia legible de valores char . Esta interfaz proporciona, acceso de sólo lectura uniforme a muchos tipos diferentes de char secuencias. Un valor char representa un carácter en el

trans-unit.source: A ChoiceFormat allows you to attach a format to a range of numbers.
trans-unit.target: Un ChoiceFormat le permite adjuntar un formato a un rango de números.

trans-unit.source: A ChoiceFormat allows you to attach a format to a range of numbers. It is generally used in a MessageFormat for handling plurals. The choice is specified with an ascending list of doubles, where each item specifies a half-open interval up to the next item:
trans-unit.target: Un ChoiceFormat le permite adjuntar un formato a un rango de números. Generalmente se usa en un MessageFormat para manejar plurales. La elección se especifica con una lista ascendente de dobles, donde cada elemento especifica un intervalo semiabierto hasta el siguiente elemento:

trans-unit.source: A ChronoLocalDate is the abstract representation of a date where the Chronology chronology, or calendar system, is pluggable. The date is defined in terms of fields expressed by TemporalField, where most common implementations are defined in ChronoField. The chronology defines how the calendar system operates and the meaning of the standard fields.
trans-unit.target: Un ChronoLocalDate es la representación abstracta de una fecha en la que se puede conectar la Chronology chronology , o sistema de calendario. La fecha se define en términos de campos expresados ​​por TemporalField , donde las implementaciones más comunes se definen en ChronoField . La cronología define cómo funciona el sistema de calendario y el significado de los campos estándar.

trans-unit.source: A ChronoLocalDateTime is the abstract representation of a local date-time where the Chronology chronology, or calendar system, is pluggable. The date-time is defined in terms of fields expressed by TemporalField, where most common implementations are defined in ChronoField. The chronology defines how the calendar system operates and the meaning of the standard fields.
trans-unit.target: Un ChronoLocalDateTime es la representación abstracta de una fecha y hora local donde se puede conectar la Chronology chronology , o el sistema de calendario. La fecha-hora se define en términos de campos expresados ​​por TemporalField , donde las implementaciones más comunes se definen en ChronoField . La cronología define cómo funciona el sistema de calendario y el significado de los campos estándar.

trans-unit.source: A ChronoZonedDateTime is the abstract representation of an offset date-time where the Chronology chronology, or calendar system, is pluggable. The date-time is defined in terms of fields expressed by TemporalField, where most common implementations are defined in ChronoField. The chronology defines how the calendar system operates and the meaning of the standard fields.
trans-unit.target: Un ChronoZonedDateTime es la representación abstracta de una fecha-hora desplazada en la que se puede conectar la Chronology chronology o el sistema de calendario. La fecha-hora se define en términos de campos expresados ​​por TemporalField , donde las implementaciones más comunes se definen en ChronoField . La cronología define cómo funciona el sistema de calendario y el significado de los campos estándar.

trans-unit.source: A ClassCastException is thrown if obj is not a primitive array of type TransferType. An ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException might be thrown if the coordinates are not in bounds, or if obj is not large enough to hold the pixel data.
A Closeable is a source or destination of data that can be closed.
trans-unit.target: Un Closeable es una fuente o destino de datos que se puede cerrar.

trans-unit.source: A Closeable is a source or destination of data that can be closed. The close method is invoked to release resources that the object is holding (such as open files).
trans-unit.target: Un Closeable es una fuente o destino de datos que se puede cerrar. El método de cierre se invoca para liberar recursos que contiene el objeto (como archivos abiertos).

trans-unit.source: A CollationKey represents a String under the rules of a specific Collator object.
trans-unit.target: Una CollationKey representa una String según las reglas de un objeto Collator específico .

trans-unit.source: A CollationKey represents a String under the rules of a specific Collator object. Comparing two CollationKeys returns the relative order of the Strings they represent. Using CollationKeys to compare Strings is generally faster than using Collator.compare. Thus, when the Strings must be compared multiple times, for example when sorting a list of Strings. It's more efficient to use CollationKeys.
trans-unit.target: Una CollationKey representa una String según las reglas de un objeto Collator específico . La comparación de dos CollationKey devuelve el orden relativo de las String que representan. Usar CollationKey s para comparar String s es generalmente más rápido que usar Collator.compare . Por lo tanto, cuando los String s deben compararse varias veces, por ejemplo, al ordenar una lista de String s. Es más eficiente usar CollationKey s.

trans-unit.source: A Collection of CRLs that match the specified selector (never null)
trans-unit.target: Una Collection de CRL que coinciden con el selector especificado (nunca null )

trans-unit.source: A Collection of Certificates that match the specified selector (never null)
trans-unit.target: Una Collection de Certificate que coinciden con el selector especificado (nunca null )
